section1.subtitle: A living heritage between spirituality, traditions and popular celebration

boxSection.item_1: At the heart of the largest Moroccan Moussem
boxSection.item_2: For centuries, the Moussem has brought together millions of visitors around spiritual rituals, fantasia, falconry and family celebrations.

section2.title: National celebration
section2.subtitle: An extraordinary event at the heart of Moroccan tradition
section2.description: Every summer, the village of Moulay Abdellah becomes the stage for a unique gathering: the Moussem Moulay Abdellah Amghar, recognized as the largest Moussem in the Kingdom and one of the most important in the Arab-Muslim world

section4.title: Organizers
section4.subtitle: An organization driven by passion and duty.

section8.title: Schedule & Activities
section8.subtitle: Spiritual values, Tribal cohesion, and Popular cultural expression

section2.title: Heritage & Identity
section2.subtitle: A living heritage between spirituality, traditions and popular celebration
section2.description: The Moussem Moulay Abdellah Amghar is a centuries-old celebration deeply rooted in the history and soul of the Kingdom. Every year, millions of Moroccans - coming from all regions and abroad - gather to honor Moulay Abdellah Amghar, an emblematic spiritual figure whose teaching continues to inspire devotion and unity. This great gathering, much more than a simple pilgrimage, is a vibrant celebration of Moroccan culture, where spirituality and popular traditions blend harmoniously. Visitors discover a profusion of ancestral rituals, enchanting Sufi chants, and folk dances that tell the story of a people proud of their roots.

section5.title: Celebration & Gathering
section5.subtitle: A moment of sharing for all generations
section5.description: In a warm and friendly atmosphere, the Moussem brings together families, friends, tradition enthusiasts and curious visitors. The program includes: religious rituals, tbourida, popular shows, falconry, local crafts and lively markets. It's a suspended moment where spirituality, heritage and popular celebration meet.

section6.title: Territory & Influence
section6.subtitle: An event serving cultural and local development
section6.description: Beyond its symbolic scope, the Moussem plays a major role in enhancing the territory and stimulating the local economy. It mobilizes hundreds of actors - artisans, artists, traders, riders, associations - and contributes to showcasing Moroccan culture in all its diversity. It is also an exceptional showcase to preserve know-how and pass on traditions to younger generations.

section2.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
section2.question_1: Where does the Moussem take place?
section2.question_2: What are the dates of the next edition?
section2.question_3: Is access to the Moussem paid?
section2.question_6: At what time do the Tbourida shows take place?
section2.question_8: Can we buy food on site?
section2.question_9: Where to consult the complete program?
section2.question_10: How to participate as an exhibitor, sponsor or rider?
section2.answer_1: The Moussem takes place in the commune of Moulay Abdellah, about ten kilometers south of El Jadida, on the Atlantic coast of Morocco.
section2.answer_2: The 2024 edition will take place from August 9 to 18, according to the calendar announced by the organizers.
section2.answer_3: No, access to the Moussem site is completely free for the public.
section2.answer_4: Shared taxis and buses regularly serve the area from El Jadida. A parking lot is usually provided for private vehicles.
section2.answer_5: Yes, the Moussem is open to all audiences, with spaces and activities adapted for children and families.
section2.answer_6: The fantasia (Tbourida) demonstrations take place daily, usually from late morning until sunset.
section2.answer_7: Most visitors stay in El Jadida or nearby. Temporary accommodations are sometimes available near the Moussem.
section2.answer_8: Yes, many stands and restaurateurs offer traditional dishes, grilled food, drinks and local sweets.
section2.answer_9: The program is published in advance of the event on the official website and relayed on our social networks.
section2.answer_10: You can contact the organization directly via the Contact page to submit a participation or partnership request

blog_1.title: Tbourida
blog_1.subtitle: heritage in full detonation
blog_1.author: Gisselle
blog_1.paragraph1_content: Every year, at the heart of the Moulay Abdellah Amghar Moussem, the earth vibrates under hooves, dust rises, and hearts suspend for a single second: that of the perfect detonation. More than a simple equestrian demonstration, Tbourida is a codified art, rooted in Moroccan warrior traditions. It embodies tribal honor, collective discipline, and the memory of ancestors. Each sorba, a troop of horsemen, executes with millimetric precision a choreography of power: starting in line, synchronized running, then simultaneous firing of artisanal rifles. Error is not permitted. Unison is a duty.
blog_1.paragraph2_title: A tradition of rigor and honor
blog_1.paragraph2_content: The riders wear bright white outfits, ride horses decorated with embroidered ornaments, and follow the orders of the moqaddem, their leader. Their gestures are slow, controlled, almost sacred. Each demonstration is the result of months of training, respect for the horse, preparation of the rifle. Through Tbourida, a part of rural Morocco's soul expresses itself: that of an oral, gestural, intergenerational transmission. It connects the young to the elders, regions to tribes, the living to the departed.
blog_1.paragraph3_content: Listed as UNESCO intangible cultural heritage, Tbourida is experiencing a new momentum today, supported by institutions while remaining deeply popular. At the Moussem, it doesn't just impress: it moves people. Because behind the dust and crash, there is the pride of a people who continue to gallop to the rhythms of their roots

blog_2.title: Living Spirituality
blog_2.subtitle: the sacred heart of the Moussem
blog_2.author: Gisselle
blog_2.paragraph1_title: A place of contemplation and faith
blog_2.paragraph1_content: While the Moulay Abdellah Amghar Moussem impresses with its cultural effervescence, it primarily draws its essence from a profound spiritual dimension. Each year, thousands of faithful flock to Moulay Abdellah's mausoleum to pay homage, recite prayers, and meditate in silence. In this sacred space, fervor replaces noise: visitors, young or old, reconnect with their faith in a climate of peace and dignity.
blog_2.paragraph2_title: A structured and vibrant religious program
blog_2.paragraph2_content: The spiritual program of the Moussem follows a structured sequence: Sufi vigils, collective readings of the Quran, religious conferences, shared invocations and blessings. These moments of communion remind us that Moroccan spirituality is made up of both ritual and human presence.
blog_2.paragraph3_title: An anchor in faith and community
blog_2.paragraph3_content: Well beyond the ceremonial aspects, the religious program of the Moussem acts as an anchor point for the community. It connects believers around common values: inner peace, generosity, brotherhood. Through the stories of Moulay Abdellah, a figure of wisdom and knowledge, visitors leave with more than memories: a renewed connection with their spiritual identity.

blog_3.title: Festive Stages
blog_3.subtitle: the artistic breath of the Moussem
blog_3.author: Gisselle
blog_3.paragraph1_title: A rendezvous with the sounds of Morocco
blog_3.paragraph1_content: From sunset, another atmosphere takes over the Moussem: that of rhythms, voices, and melodies. On the large stages set up in the open air, artists from all over the country take over from horsemen and falconers. Popular songs, collective dances, tribal percussions... the Moussem then becomes an immense open-air stage, vibrant with sounds and lights.
blog_3.paragraph2_title: A program between tradition and modernity
blog_3.paragraph2_content: The artistic program of the Moussem offers remarkable diversity: chaâbi music concerts, gnaoua troupes, aïta songs, Amazigh ahwach, malhoun, or even Halqa dance succeed each other every evening. These shows are free, open to all, and attract both families and younger generations. By valuing both big names and local artists, the Moussem becomes a space for the living transmission of Moroccan musical heritage
blog_3.paragraph3_title: A culture that gives and shares
blog_3.paragraph3_content: Beyond entertainment, these evenings have a unifying role. They allow each region to showcase its colors and sounds, while creating a friendly atmosphere where people dance, sing, and celebrate together. This popular, open, and inclusive stage reflects a plural Morocco, rooted and in movement. A Morocco where music is not a simple backdrop, but a common language.

blog_4.title: Tbourida & Falconry
blog_4.subtitle: the two faces of bravery
blog_4.author: Gisselle
blog_4.paragraph1_title: The earth trembles, the rifles sing
blog_4.paragraph1_content: Every morning at the Moussem, the vast plains of Moulay Abdellah become the theater of Tbourida. In perfect line, the horsemen rush at full speed, swords raised, eyes fixed. Then, in a synchronized breath, the rifles thunder in unison. This is not a show: it's a declaration of identity, a warrior choreography transmitted by blood and memory. Each sorba embodies the honor of its tribe, the elegance of its culture, the mastery of an art where error has no place.
blog_4.paragraph2_title: The sky also has its masters
blog_4.paragraph2_content: Not far from the fantasia fields, silence settles: that of falcon hunting. Here, bravery is not shouted, it is observed. The falconers of the Abda tribe raise and train these raptors with patience and respect. In their measured gestures, their attentive gaze, one reads an ancient knowledge, made of complicity between man and bird. Falconry, rare and precious, is a noble discipline, an ancestral art where mastery comes through restraint.
blog_4.paragraph3_content: At first glance, everything seems to oppose the ardor of Tbourida and the serenity of falconry. And yet, both tell the same story: that of a rooted people, proud of their customs, capable of making the earth vibrate as well as taming the sky. Together, they form a symbolic duo, which makes the Moussem a unique place in the world where the most beautiful forms of tribal bravery are expressed, on two terrains: the ground, and the infinite

blog_5.title: The Halqa
blog_5.subtitle: the living circle of memory
blog_5.author: Gisselle
blog_5.paragraph1_content: At the turn of a square or in the shade of a tent, a circle forms. Children settle in front, elders in the back, passersby stop, curious. In the center, a lone man, without scenery or microphone, captures all attention. This is the hlayqi, the master of words. The Halqa, an ancestral form of popular theater, transforms public space into a living stage. Historical tales, fantastic stories, social critiques, or satirical songs: here, everything passes through the word.
blog_5.paragraph2_title: An art of rhythm and gaze
blog_5.paragraph2_content: The secret of the Halqa lies not only in the story but in the way it is told. Voice that climbs and descends, broad gestures, dramatic pauses, knowing looks: every moment is meticulous. The artist improvises with his audience, plays with their reactions, bounces off a word or a laugh. It is an art of pure orality, where memory and spontaneity are the only instruments. Through the Halqa, it is an entire way of observing the world that is transmitted.
blog_5.paragraph3_content: At the Moulay Abdellah Moussem, the Halqa is not just entertainment, it's a tool for popular transmission. The stories told carry life lessons, cultural reference points, values of justice or solidarity. By making people laugh or reflect, they help keep entire generations of stories and identities alive. The circle remains open... so that memory continues to turn.

blog_6.title: Flavors of the Moussem
blog_6.subtitle: when tradition is savored
blog_6.author: Gisselle
blog_6.paragraph1_title: An atmosphere that begins on the plate
blog_6.paragraph1_content: At the Moulay Abdellah Moussem, aromas sometimes precede the shows. In every alley, around the tents and at the heart of the grand souk, the smells of grilled meat, warm spices, and freshly baked bread float in the air. Gastronomy is not accessory: it is an integral part of the experience. Eating here means immersing oneself in a terroir, a heritage, a Moroccan way of life.
blog_6.paragraph2_content: One savors a crispy msemen, a bowl of steaming harira, a tender mechoui, or even a mint tea served high, with a smile. The recipes are passed down between generations, the dishes prepared on site, sometimes right on the ground. No menu or card: everything is instinctive, oral, living. Behind each dish lies regional expertise, a cooking rhythm, a precise hand.
blog_6.paragraph3_content: Here, one never eats alone. Food brings together, unites, creates exchange between visitors. It is an extension of the Moussem in its most intimate form: sharing. Through gastronomy, these are stories of families, seasons, tribes, and millennial gestures that are told. A tradition that one does not watch, but tastes, together

blog_7.title: Development Catalyst
blog_7.subtitle: The Moussem, a catalyst for local development
blog_7.author: Gisselle
blog_7.paragraph1_title: When tradition becomes an economic lever
blog_7.paragraph1_content: The Moulay Abdellah Moussem is not just a festive event: it is also a powerful engine for local revitalization. Each edition attracts millions of visitors, generating a massive influx of consumption in the commune and its surroundings. Transporters, restaurateurs, artisans, accommodations: all see their activity multiplied. The event acts as an accelerator of opportunities for small local businesses.
blog_7.paragraph2_content: Around the Moussem, a whole informal and circular economy activates. Young people set up stands, cooperatives exhibit their products, families rent spaces, and even neighboring communes benefit from indirect spinoffs. The event creates connections, circulation, and resources. It also stimulates pride of belonging to the territory, which strengthens local social capital.
blog_7.paragraph3_title: A strategic showcase for the region
blog_7.paragraph3_content: Thanks to its national reputation and the media coverage it generates, the Moussem plays a key role in the visibility of the El Jadida province and the Doukkala region. It attracts investors, decision-makers, journalists, and tourists, while offering a valued narrative framework: authenticity, tradition, hospitality, potential. The Moussem thus becomes an identity platform, serving territorial development

blog_8.title: Craftsmanship & Know-how
blog_8.subtitle: the other wealth of the Moussem
blog_8.author: Gisselle
blog_8.paragraph1_title: The souk, a space of creativity and heritage
blog_8.paragraph1_content: At the heart of the Moussem, the traditional grand souk becomes a living gallery of what the region produces most authentically: Berber weavings, pottery, jewelry, musical instruments, local products. This is not a classic commercial fair, it's a space for showcasing manual knowledge, where each object tells of an origin, a technique, a family.
blog_8.paragraph2_title: Artisans in the spotlight, territories in the light
blog_8.paragraph2_content: For many artisans, exhibiting at the Moussem is a rare chance: that of confronting their know-how with a national audience, selling without intermediaries, and establishing direct commercial relationships. The Moussem then becomes a unique marketing stage, which strengthens rural microeconomies while disseminating products rooted in local culture.
blog_8.paragraph3_content: This craftsmanship should not only be seen as decorative or folkloric: it is a vector of sustainable development, a pillar of the social economy, and a central element of the territory's brand image. By focusing on this know-how, the region asserts a strong, creative, and authentic identity — ready to seduce well beyond its borders
